labels.text: In this painting, the identical hairstyles and attire of the businessmen standing under the rainbow represents the growing influence of western consumerism. The appearance of the men indicates the changing social environment and economic status of China. While the laughing masks and their body language convey harmony, each man’s stiff, oversized hands betray anxiety and discontent. This painting is part of the Mask series, which Zeng Fanzhi began after he moved to Beijing in the early 1990s. He was astonished by the rapid urbanisation and economic development of the art capital and expressed this through depictions of city dwellers wearing identical stylised masks. Echoing the theme of disguise, he moved away from the expressionist brushwork of his earlier work, and instead used a palette knife to smooth the paint’s surface, hiding any lingering emotions.

While the laughing masks and body language convey harmony, each man’s stiff, oversized hands betray anxiety and discontent. This painting is part of the Mask series, which Zeng Fanzhi began after he moved to Beijing in the early 1990s. 站在彩虹下的幾位商人，擁有相同的髮型和西裝款式，象徵著西方消費主義影響日深。畫中人的外貌，正顯示出中國社會環境和經濟狀況的轉變。雖然戴著面具的各人笑容滿面，姿勢和諧一致，但一雙雙拘謹的大手卻出賣了他們，流露出焦慮與不安。此作品是《面具》系列的其中一幅，於曾梵志在90年代初移居北京時所創作。這個藝術之都急速的城市化和經濟發展，讓他大感驚訝，因而啟發他在作品中繪畫佩戴一式一樣面具的城市人。為了呼應「偽裝」這個主題，他摒棄早期作品的表現主義筆觸，轉而採用油畫刀抹平顏料，隱藏所有在畫面上顯露的情感。

images.AltText: Oil painting on canvas featuring five men posing under a rainbow with their arms around each other. They wear fashionable suits and white masks with oversized smiles.
